class SXF_ElemBucket

Interface

Public Members
virtual ~SXF_ElemBucket()
virtual int openObject(const char* bucketType) = 0
virtual void update() = 0
virtual void close() = 0
virtual int openAttribute(const char* name)
virtual void closeAttribute()
virtual int openArray() = 0
virtual void closeArray() = 0
virtual int openHash() = 0
virtual void closeHash() = 0
virtual int setScalarValue(double value) = 0
virtual int setArrayValue(double value) = 0
virtual int setHashValue(double value, int index) = 0
Protected Members
SXF_ElemBucket(SXF_OStream& out, const char* bucketType, SXF_ElemBucketHash* hash)
void setType(const char* bucketType)

Description

The ElemBucket class defines an interface to element buckets, orthogonal collections of element attributes. Physically, these collections are implemented by the ElemBucketHash instances, hashes of attributes key and values. The SXF front end provides hashes for most SIF/MAD elements. However, this list can be extended for new projects.

The element attributes values may be one of two types: numeric literal and numeric literal array.

Member Description

virtual ~SXF_ElemBucket()

Destructor.

virtual int openObject(const char* bucketType) = 0

Prepare a bucket reader for operations. Return SXF_TRUE or SXF_FALSE.

virtual void update() = 0

Complete all operations.

virtual void close() = 0

Return a bucket reader to its initial conditions.

virtual int openAttribute(const char* name)

Select a bucket attribute and make it current.

virtual void closeAttribute()

Close a current attribute.

virtual int openArray() = 0

Open an array of attribute values.

virtual void closeArray() = 0

Close an array of attribute values.

virtual int openHash() = 0

Open a hash of attribute values.

virtual void closeHash() = 0

Close a hash of attribute values.

virtual int setScalarValue(double value) = 0

Define a scalar value.

virtual int setArrayValue(double value) = 0

Define an array element value.

virtual int setHashValue(double value, int index) = 0

Define a hash element value.

SXF_ElemBucket(SXF_OStream& out, const char* bucketType, SXF_ElemBucketHash* hash)

Constructor.

void setType(const char* bucketType)

Set type.
